Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the system by stating that it saved over a billion dollars on welfare, when in reality it refers to savings from the food stamp program specifically.
Understate: The claim understates the scope of the savings by focusing only on the food stamp program and not including other forms of public assistance.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that the system saved over a billion dollars.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the savings were solely due to the system that the candidate helped invent, without considering other factors that may have contributed to the savings.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the savings, such as other initiatives or efforts that may have contributed to reducing waste and fraud in the welfare system.
